page.title: 03LOUGHWOOD BAPTIST CHAPEL
page.content: Loughwood Chapel was built in 1653. It is built of stone. The roof is made of reed thatch.The pews in the chapel are like cubicles with locks on the doors so that the people in them could only see the preacher. There is a pit where people were baptised in spring water.There is said to be a secret door behind the pulpit so that the preacher could escape if soldiers came. People in the seventeenth century were persecuted for their beliefs.The chapel was originally surrounded by woodland and people came to worship on horse back. There are rings on the stable wall where horses were tethered. A man named Isaac Hann, who died on 17th March 1778, is buried in the churchyard. The chapel now belongs to the National Trust and services are still held there.
